item.title: Quickly check if a process is running or not
item.description: When writting bash scripts one often needs to see if a process is running or not I like the following code; though I’m sure many ways of doing this exists, what’s your favorite? if [ -z "$(pgrep process)" ]; then echo "process is not running" else echo "process is running" fi

item.title: Killall for windows :)
item.description: Ever wanted to kill a process from the command line in windows? Here’s how: If you know the name of a process to kill, for example firefox.exe, use the following command from a command prompt to end it: taskkill /IM firefox.exe This will cause the program to terminate gracefully, asking for confirmation if there are unsaved changes. To forcefully kill the same process, add the /F option to the command line.
